data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In order to reach the starting point you must always face forward. When facing forward you take 9 steps left. When faced away you take 10 steps forward. When facing forward you take 9 steps right. When faced backward you take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 7 steps, you must take 1, then take 7 steps. You can return to the starting point if you take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Once you return, you must take at least one full turn. The process of taking one full turn takes 9 steps. The way you take 9 steps is the same as the way you take 3 steps. If you take 3 steps first then you have to turn around to make 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

People tend to turn around when they come to a starting point. It is always right and makes sense that someone would turn to the left to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
